plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are iconic flowering shrubs known for their layered petals and pleasant fragrance. In temperate regions, many rose varieties are in full bloom during late spring to early summer, including June. They are widely cultivated in gardens and parks worldwide.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, including Europe, North America, and parts of Asia
plants.funFact: Roses have been cultivated for over 5,000 years and are symbols of love and beauty in many cultures.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: Lupines are herbaceous plants with tall spikes of flowers resembling pea blossoms. They thrive in temperate climates and bloom in late spring to early summer. Often found in wild meadows and cultivated gardens, they are nitrogen-fixing plants that improve soil fertility.
plants.location: North America and parts of Europe, especially in cooler temperate zones
plants.funFact: Some species of lupines can fix nitrogen in the soil, making them valuable in crop rotation.

plants.name: Delonix regia
plants.description: A striking tree known for its vivid scarlet flowers and fern-like leaves. It blooms in late spring to early summer in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fiery red-orange flowers create spectacular displays in urban and natural landscapes.
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions, including the Caribbean, Africa, and South Asia
